11.content:
Malachi strolled a back alley of New York City, his only source of light, the pale moon shining overhead.

A slight breeze could be felt, causing his leather jacket to billow slightly in the wind. Other than that, the street was silent.

"Where are they," he wonders, frustration setting in. This hunt so far has proven very unsuccessful. That is, until he hears a scream coming from around the corner of a building.

Reaching unter his coat, he felt for the reassuring touch of his antique short swords. Then he took off at a run.

When he rounded a corner, he saw...
11.title: Malachi's Hunt

choices: Leave her. You can't protect both of you.
111.content:
A vampire had a hold of a woman in her early 20's trying desperately to bite her neck.

"Hey, man, What's goin' on?" Malachi asked in mock ignorance.

The vampire turned, his glowing red eyes fixated on the newcomer. He momentarilly forgets about his original target, bares his fangs and charged.

In one fluid motion, Malachi draws one of his swords and neatly lops off the head of the vampire. Upon impacting the ground, both the head and body incinerate in a flash of blue and red flames.

Malachi walks over to the girl and helps her to her feet.

"You better get home," he tells her. "There's a world of beasties out at this time of night."

"No, I can't. I have to find my boyfriend. He disappeared last night, and... I just need to find him."

"Have you tried the police?"

"Yes, but I don't think his disappearance is natural. You apparrently know about monsters and stuff. I could come with you, you could help me find him."

"Oh, I don't think..."

"You have to! I'm..your my only hope. Please."

What do you do?
111.title: Damsel in Distress

choices: five or six vampires performing a sacred ritual
1111.content:
"Fine, you can come," Malachi says sternly. "Just be careful."

"Oh, I will." The girl replies.

Malachi mutters something under his breath as he takes off in the opposite direction.

The girl takes off at a light jog to catch up to him.

"I'm Molly," she offers.

"That's nice." Malachi says, not even looking at her. Several moments of tension pass before he speaks up. "Name's Malachi."

"Malachi," she repeats, "That's biblical, isn't it?"

"Yeah."

"So... how'd you get wrapped up in this whole business of kill..." Molly starts, but is cut off by a wave of Malachi's hand.

"What is it?" Molly asked, feafully.

Malachi and Molly cautiously make their way across the street and find...
1111.title: Come Along, Then.

11112.content:
In front of them lay a man no more thatn twenty years of age. His eyes were wide open and there was blood all over his body. Two puncture holes were aparent on his neck.
Malichi moved closer. He bent down and checked the man's pulse.
"He's dead." Malichi started to walk off when a familiar voice came from the shadows.
" Malichi?" asked a feminine voice.

Who was it?

A six foot tall demon grabbing daggers shieved into the lager one back. The large demon back handed the other who flew back with the beasts heart in his hands.

The creature fell over dead while the small demon began devouring its heart. Malachi swiftly pierced the demons heart said "The only way to kill one of you. Ya know too many monsters die this way." and turned to the man and yelled to get lost which of course he did.

Well at least you would be if I were just some normal demon" Malachi turned, pointed his blades at the creature, and said "Who and what the hell are you!" to which the demon replied "But of course how rude of me my name is, drum roll please Vorak Vongor Kasen!" ... Malachi"Umm who?" Vorak "Yes of course you're stunned.. wait you mean, agh.

Surprise! Someone appears behind the body, their sword also drawn and...

114.title: Encounter

12.content:
Mary was bored and she was beginning to wonder why she even agreed to attend this seminar. Why did she have to know how to run a small business, anyways. She could curse her friend, Amy, who had convinced her to go.

She glanced down at her watch.

7:30

Great, she thought. Still another hour to go. Pretty soon she shut the speaker out and glanced out the window she was sitting by.

It was getting pretty dark, barely enough light to see. She was about to turn around when something caught her eye. She wasn't sure what it was at first, but when she looked again, she was overtaken with dread.

She couldn't believe it. What she saw emerging from the nearby woods was a hoarde of...
12.title: Mary's Beginning

121.content:
Zombies. Hundreds of dead, decaying temples of human flesh, slowly making their way across school grounds.

Mary was speechless and in a state of shock, shock that was only broken when someone yelled, "Oh my God, outside!"

In that instant, the students burst into a mad frenzy as they all dashed for the door.

"Come on,Mary," Amy yelled, "I think we can make a break for it. Get to my car and drive to safety."



What do you do, go with Amy, or barricade yourself in the school and hide?
121.title: Dead Men on Campus

1211.content:
Mary followed Amy through the hallway until they reached the doors that led outside.

Amy went through first, and Mary was about to follow suit. But what she saw made her suddenly change her mind.

A zombie, one that had obviously been dead for years, not much more than a skeleton with sticky green flesh barely clinging to the bone, had taken hold of Amy and was preparing to feed.

"Help me!" She yelled as the zombie dug his rotting teeth into Amy's scalp. It was too late.

The zombie let Amy's body tumble to the floor and approached the entrance to the school.

She quickly slammed the door shut and turned to take shelter with the others. The only problem was... She didn't know which way they had gone.

She had two choices, either take the left hallway, or the right. Which should she choose.
1211.title: On Second Thought...

12111.content:
She chose the left.

She checked the doors as she ran, trying to find out where everyone went. But there was nothing. Only empty science labs, offices, a snack room.

As she rounded a corner, she was tackled to the ground by an unknown assailant.

"Help me," she screamed, tears streaming down her face. The zombie was fierce, and incredibly nimble for someone who was dead. He also proved to be very strong. He bit and tore at Mary, trying to sink his teeth into her soft flesh.

The zombie had Mary pinned now, with his face drawing closer. She could smell the stench of death coming off him in waves. Then he went in for the kill.
12111.title: Left Hallway

121111.content:
As the zombie diges into her flesh with his dirty and grimy teeth, Masr feel the pain enter her arm. Once the pain filles her arm, she sees a chunck of flesh missing from her arm. She is stunned, and feels more pain, thins time on her legs.

It would appear that the zxombie that pinned her down was not the only one in the room, as a hord of at least three more come running into the room, all looking for more fresh meat, which Mary just happonds to be.

While Mary is struggling, she realizes that this just might be



The End.
121111.title: The zombie bites her

123.content:
Mary watched the sky go red as people came in.
"Odd coloured sky..." She muttered to Amy. Amy gave a brief nod and opened her mouth to speak. A loud boom shaked the table, a crow squwarked in fear. The moon hid in the shadows, too scared of what was ti come. The room was silent, all eyes turned towards the window. A beam of red light ripped the sky, tree's died and screams could be heard. Winged creatures, glided down. They marked doomsday, they marked death. The windows smashed, and the world Mary had come to know crumbled in a second.

"A...Amy?" A whisper came. A hand slithered out from the rubble, searching for her friend. Her eyes were blurred, her vision fading, "Amy...?" She muttered weakly, her eyes fell onto Amy. Her cold dead eyes glaired at her in horror. "Amy...?" Mary muttered, wishing it was all but a dream. A tear fell from her eyes as she saw more fallen comrades, untill she passed out in vomit.

"Wake up... wake up" A voice called from the darkness. Her eyes slit open,
"A dream...?" She whispered, hopefull. The boy that stood infront of her shook his head,
"A nightmare... its like, devil may cry out there." He adjusted his glasses, and curled up on her bed.

Silence.

"Um... thank you for saving me." She muttered, offering out her hand.
"Adam" He clutched her hand. A bang could be heard. They both held there breath
123.title: A portal of demon

choices: Grab Amy and make a run for it
Contemplate a plan on what to do
124.content:
Ghosts. A horrendous amount of shattered souls with no body to reside in flowed in a massive wave of transparent bodies along the school grounds.

Mary's breath was caught in her throat at the sight. Children, women, males, even pets, all long departed, were right outside! The horror of some of them missing heads or limbs was almost too much, but she couldn't turn away.

One of the ghosts eyes blazed red and they immediately connected with the girls. The ghastly figure was on a horse, whose eyes were also a crimson color.

A student glanced toward the window where she was looking out of, immediately paled, and yelled in fright. After that, everyone's attention was on the outside. Nobody ran, the atmosphere was quiet aside from a couple harsh gasps and deep intake of breaths.

How could they possibly get away from ghosts..?
124.title: Spirits are About

13.content:
Adam scratched his head and pushed his glasses up his noise. He knew he shouldn't be out this late, but he had gotten a call from GameStop; his advance copy of Lord of War was in. There was no way he was going to let that sit in there store all night.

         He wished, though, that he had thought to come with a friend. He kept getting the feeling that he was being followed. He probably wasn't, because this was a good neighborhood, but he wasn't positive. Maybe he was just being paranoid.

         Suddenly, behind him, someone started whistling. Adam jumped, but continued walking. It's probably nothing, he thought. Just somebody out for a walk, whistling so I know they're there.

         Nevertheless, he quickened his pace. The first chance he got, he glanced over his shoulder.

         There was no one there.

         He quickened his pace once more. His heart was racing and his palms sweating. He would have been fine, but then the whistling picked back up.

         His eyes wide with fear, Adam started jogging.

         Something right by his face brushed against his ear. A voice whispered "Adam..."

What's there?
13.title: Lullaby In Birdland

choices: Adam finds he wasn't really alone
Adam finds his way home without inciddent
132.content: Adam spun around, feet slipping on loose rocks. He hit the pavement. . .hard. But not as hard as his laptop did. He, at least, didn't splinter into numerous peices. After a quick look around and the realization that no one was there, began scooping up the peices. "Crap. . ." he muttered. Only to hear a high-pitched laugh float down the street. "Very funny," he screamed. There was no response. Just a small gust of wind. He got up, brushed himself off, and continued walking.
132.title: The Laugh

choices: Sai in one hand, jump and climb down the ladder
Knives at the ready, jump across to follow main tunnel
Attack the source of the noise to the right
Head for the sound of running water to the left
Retreat, making note of the coordinates, to return with reinforcements
14.content:
Eve ran, ducking from one shadow to the next, racing to catch the fleeing figure in the tunnels before it got to one of their strongholds. One beast she could fight easily, slitting its throat and gouging its blood red eyes before it could reach her mind. But a nest, that would be a challenge even with her ninja training.

She would have let the bloodsucker go, but for Malachi's challenge, that she was getting lazy and not getting her share of drone kills. He acted like he was the only warrior in the city; alone in keeping the above-ground safe for the daily worker drones as they went about their business, oblivious to the teeming life below.

Silence ahead, the beast had disappeared. Eve slowed her approach, listening with all her senses, feeling her way among the litter of castoffs and trash in the intermittent light. She had to be near a nest. There was a pit with two rungs of a ladder visible near the top straight ahead, with the main tunnel a short jump across. A rustling, sloughing sound, in the narrower tunnel to the right, the scent of rain and a sound of water running in the passage to her left, silence behind her.
14.title: Eve's  Underground Encounter

choices: Both women walk silently through the tunnel...waiting
As Eve and Mary walk back through the tunnel, they spot the nest...
142.content:
Once she landed she crouched listening with all her senses. That small yet distinct sound again from the right tunnel. Standing she made her way to that side of the tunnel leaning against the cold, dank wall. Alert, creeping along and poised for action she spotted a shadow ahead and tensed, ready for battle.

Suddenly she saw a flash of the creatures blood red eyes flash very close to her and she STRUCK with both hands knives flashing so fast you couldn't see them. The creature writhed with the impact and the sound she heard was insidious, a dull, sickening crack. Eve knew she hit bone and she twisted her knives in further waiting for the creatures dying hiss.

Satisfied it was dead she pulled her knives out, and kept them ready to strike again. Still creeping along the tunnel wall she came to a divide, kept to the right and heard more creatures. Looking beyond the dark with her ninja skills she leaned forward and this time hit two of the creatures! More glorious killing sounds and as she pulled her knives out she turned to see Mary behind her.

"About time," Eve smirked. Mary only smiled, put her fingers to her lips and said, "Shhh, follow me." Eve stepped over the dead bodies and quickly followed Mary. Looking back she shuddered and watched the creatures slimy disintegrating bodies disappear.
142.title: Knives at the ready, jump across to follow main...

choices: Decide to go back the way you came.
Follow the water, watching closely for leeches.
Hope your legs can support you and try the grate above you.
144.content:
She knew that the beast had more than likely gone down the hole, but she hoped that the tunnel to the left would lead to another section of this tunnel. The water was an added boon, promising protection at least from this type of creature as she scouted about. Slowly she moved toward the sound of water, keeping an eye out behind her until she felt the rain from above falling through a grate and landing on her clothes. It was a heavy downpour and in a mere moment her clothing was drenched. That did not bother her as much as it once would have, before she started fighting these demons.

The water ran around her calves fiercely, clean and fresh, at least until it got farther down the line. Eve breathed a slight sigh of relief, looking up through the grate once more and failing to notice a slightly glowing shape in the water, moving silently toward her then disappearing. She gasps as her head slams into the wall behind her, her feet held in a vice like grip and yanked from beneath her. Struggling she forces her arms behind her and pushes up, one hand reaching for the dagger at her hip. By now her feet were going numb and there was a hot stabbing pain radiating from where the thing grabbed her. Grunting she grabs her knife and reaches down, hacking at what was on her legs until the pressure slowly faded, leaving nothing but the pain. Carefully she pulled at the thing to see what it was.

The thing was long, fat, and a greyish brown color with shiny yellow and blow streaks. On the top it looked harmless, if dead, but when she turned it over she saw rows of black tipped spikes and rows of vicious circular mouths all along the spongy flesh. Great! The bloodsuckers were seeding the water with their bane-leeches, and apparently the leeches were eating well because this one was the larges she had ever seen.She was going to have to tell Malachi about this.

Setting the leech corpse aside for a moment, she looked down at her legs. Her feet were regaining feeling but that was not a good thing, they hurt like hell and her pants were practically gone from the knee down, leaving torn flesh. The area around the multiple bites was turning purple and a little yellow. Great, now she had to worry about poison in her system. Ah well, she was resistant to most of them, and as for physical damage, the bleeding had stopped so at least she was not going to bleed to death.

Once she was safely out of the water but close enough to discourage the other beasty she had been chasing, she looked around and took stock of her location. Biting her lip but not hoping for much, she checked her cell signal. Nope, nothing, In her mind she imagined the Verizon guy down here, and out loud she said "Can you hear me now?" and let out a chuckle. Oh great, she was going loopy, she needed to get out of here fast. She could of course go back the way she just came, but she had mixed feelings about that. On the one hand there could be untold bloodsuckers back there, but that is the way she knew for sure she could get back to the others. She could also continue to follow the tunnel with the water in it, but who knew how many leeches were housed in that deceptively safe liquid, and she only had so much blood to spare. The other option she had was to try and scale the slippery wall and go up through the grate, it did look pretty loose, but she had NO idea where it would take her or if it would get her even deeper in trouble than she was now.
144.title: Head for the sound of running water to the left

15.content:
Gwen looked in front of her as a monster with two heads looked around for food, she was hiding. Right now, she felt naked without any weapons to kill this being. Her skinny jeans only held her Ipod, that she turned off when she first noticed this demon. Not truly understanding what the hell was happening, she stayed there waiting for her chance to run. She looked at her tight form fitting t-shirt. It was her favorite Misfits t-shirt, the one that said Die, Die My Darling. She wore it often, but now regretted it, she didn't want to get any blood on it.

She saw her chance when the demon turned his head hearing a baby cry. Gwen didn't like it, but she had to think of herself right now and get a weapon. Her long blood red hair followed close behind her as she darted, her converse shoes kicked dirt up in the air in a cloud. She knew that she would be caught if ever the demon even heard her. Running so fast, she never even noticed the person who was slinking from shadow to shadow, feeling so stupid when she took a header.

They both ended up on the ground. both were dazed now and any demon could've killed them, but luckily there were none.


Who did she smack in to?
15.title: Gwen

choices: Search the monster for something you could use as a weapon
151.content:
Gwen rammed into something hard and fell on her butt. She blinked and looked up at a man who stared down at her with hard, cold eyes. He looked in his twenties and didn't seem too friendly. She quickly scrambled up and pulled on the guys jacket.

"Hey, stranger, we gotta go!" She hissed. He didn't budge more move at all no matter how hard she pulled. "Dude, we gotta leave! There's a monster back there!"

He stared at her for a moment then looked in the direction of the screaming woman and crying baby. He roughly grabbed Gwens wrist and forced her off. "Stay back." He ordered in a deep voice. "Hide and don't come out until it's safe." He then calmly walked forward.

She stared after him. "Are you crazy!?" She hissed after him. "You'll die!"

She had a perfect angle of him and the monster. The demon was holding up a woman and her child, screming for her life as they dangled over it's gaping mouths. She watched at the man pulled out a sword from his leather jacket. He was walking at a slow pace, and then in a blink he was on te other side of the demon, standing still. The monsters eyes went wide as its arm slowly slid off. The mother screamed as they fell to the ground, but a blur rushed by Gwen and caught the arm and jumped back by her. Gwent stared wide eyed at a woman with short black hair as she effortlessly pried open the fingers and helped the mother out of the hand.

"There you go!" She said happily in a British accent.

"Oh, thank you! Thank you!" She shouted and ran off past Gwen.

Gwen stared after the mother and child. "That was..." She stared back at the strange woman and man. "Amazing!" She breathed.

The monster roared and stumbled back, holding its bloody arm. "Oi! Malachi!" The woman shouted. "Put the bloody thing out of its misery, would ya? The thing sounds like a dieing cat and is making my ears bleed." She grumbled and twisted a pinky in her ear.

Malachi turned his head slingtly. "Right." The moster roared again as it lunged for him.

He waited for the last moment before he spun around, swinging his sword at the demon. He seemed unfazed as the heads rolled past him and blood splashed on him. He took a step as the body fell to the ground in front of him. He then calmly pulled out a napkin and cleaned his sword and face. The woman rushed up to him as he tossed the wadded napkin to the side.

"Oh my..." Gwen slowly came out of her hiding place as she stared at the two. "You guys are..." She could say a full sentence she was so shocked at what she saw. They glanced at her then Malachi put his sword back and both begun to walk away.
151.title: Malachi

choices: Leave her and run off on your own
Grab her and lead her to a safer location
152.content:
Gwen blinked a few times before she stopped seeing double. She stared at a girl about her age, still in a daze, with blonde hair and highlights.

"Hey, girl!" She whipered and shook her shoulders. "Girl, snap out of it!"

"Uh-huh...?" She rubbed her forehead and looked up at Gwen. "Who'er you...?"

"No time!" She hissed and glanced back, making sure the monster wasn't coming after them. Thankfully it was busy digging for the unfortunate humans. She hated just leaving them, but what could she do?

"Uh- hey!" The girl shoved Gwen. "What the hell is your problem! You should really watch where you're going, you know?" She snapped.

Gwen blinked at her in bewilderment. Is she serious? There's a monster behind them! "Listen, person, we have to run!" She hissed. "And stop shouting!"

"Hey! Don't boss a stranger!" She snapped. The demon stopped and twisted its heads around, looking for the sorce of the noise.

Gwen began to panic as she saw the monster sniffing around. "Girl, seriously! Shut up and move it!" She stood and grabbed her arm, forcing her to stand.

"What is your problem!?" She yanked her arm back. "You know you're not very good at inroductions. Just what's the ma-" She went wide eyed and screamed at the top of her lungs.

Gwen whirled around and made eye contact with the monster. It grinned as acid dripped from both mouths. "Run!" She shouted and dragged the girl behind her as the monster raced after them.

"What is that thing!?" The girl shouted as they ran for their lives.

"How should I know!?" Gwen snapped back as the monster caught up to them. Gwen egarly looked for a way out and spotted a narrow ally way. "This way!" She shouted and pulled the girl along with her, the monster just missing them in its jaws. They quckly squeezed themselves in and rushed towards the back. The monster pounded and roared as it tried to break open the space wider to get to them.

"It's going to kill us!" The girl shouted in fright. "Run!" She egarly pushed Gwen along and shoved her in another ally way that veered left.

They slowly made their way down, but eventually the space was to tight to continue. They went as far as they could and stopped to breath. They could hear the monster roar in anger and continue to pound on the buldings. The girl was muttering somthing as Gwen sent a silent prayer to the heveans. After a while the monster stopped and gave a final roar. They stayed silent until they were sure the monster had left.
152.title: Mary

choices: escort the mother and child to safety
154.content:
Gwen blinked at the woman with short black hair who was mumbling to herself and rubbing her head.

"What in the world?" She looked up and glared at Gwen. Gwen jerked her head back from surprise. She quickly turned nervous from her glare and knowing the demon was far back. What if it heard them? They'd both be dead! "What the bloody hell are you doing here?" She snapped annoyed and stood up. "Don't you know there's a demon here?"

Gwens brown eyes widened, and then she quickly jumped up and covered the woman's mouth. "Please be quiet!" She hissed. "The demons right back there! If it hears us-"

"Step aside." She said and shoved her to the side. "If it hears us then there's a chance we can save that annoying, crying baby and it's mum." She replied lazily to Gewn's surprise.

"B-but we don't have any weapons!" She protested.

The woman smirked. "I don't need weapons." She replied matter-o-fact, and then stepped out in the open, glaring at the two headed monster then was rummaging though the debris of the broken building. "Oi!" She shouted and Gewn freaked out. "Ugly! You want some food!?"

One of the heads turned around and grinned at them, acid dripping from it's mouth. "We're going to die!" She muttered to herself. "Are you crazy!" She shouted at the woman. "You've killed us both!"

"Oh relax." She waved her off and smirked as the demon turned and charged at them. "This bloke's nothing but a warm up!" She then ran at the monster and jumped in the air, doing a spin kick in on eof the monsters two heads.

The first head she hit colided wit the second and the demon stumbled. Gwen stared in awe. This woman was unreal! The woman then jumped and kicked the monster again, sending it to the ground. She grabbed it's arm and twisted it behind it's back. The monster shouted in pain.

"That's right!" She shouted with some effort. "Say uncle! Say it!" Then with a little more force she broke the arm.

The two heads roared in pain and anger then twisted their heads to glare at her. Its massive tail lifted up and swung down at her. The woman spun around and grabbed the end of the tail easily. She hopped off its back then begun spinning around. Soon enough the creature was off the ground and whirling around in the air in a blur. Gwen blinked as she released the thing and sent it crashing heads first into the wall. The wall broke and crumbled, rubbled falling onto the dead monster. The woman dusted her hands off, looking satisfied, and then turned as a woman holding a baby ran out from their hiding spot towards her.

"Oh, thank you, thank you!" The mother cried as the baby was finally quiet. "You saved our lives! How can I ever repay you?"

The woman cracked her knuckles. "Well you can get out of here for one." She replied. "There might be more around the area so you better get moving." With that she walked away.

"Alright, I will." The mother bowed. "Thank you again! We owe you our lives!" She called and ran in the other direction.

Gwen stepped out of her hiding place and stared at the dead demon in a daze. That woman just obliterated that thing like it was nothing! She looked at the woman then at the mother and child. What does she do now?
154.title: Eve

info.brief_description: Vampires, zombies,werewolves,monsters. How will you handle the onslaugh of evil.
info.description:
Various creatures of the night have been unleashed! You must find a way to stop the swelling of their numbers and silence their spread of evil once and for all.

First off, the main characters:

Malachi: In his 20s. He wears black boots, black jeans, black T-shirt and a knee length leather jacket. Unlike the others, he knows these creatures and he actually searches them out. He keeps a pair of short daggers/swords under his jacket. The other characters will have to find weapons as they go.

Mary: 18. Very preppy and popular. Averadge height,slim build, dark blond hair with light blond highlights. She is usually wearing something in the way of hip hugger jeans and a pink tank top, or some variation. She is very smart, but is a little on the prissy side, so she gets scared a lot easier than the others.

Adam: Also smart, but more in the sense of being a geek. Wears glasses, has long,unkempt hair,blue jeans and some sort of flannel shirt. He almost always carries a laptop around.

Eve: She is kind of the female counterpart of Malachi. A trained fighter who wastes no time in attempting to take down the monsters. She usually dresses in red leather pants, black tank top and a short black leather jacket. She has shoulder length black hair and has a slight accent, maybe british?

Rules
Please keep the story in third person.

For the most part, anything goes, but I don't want anything crude or pornographic. I will edit things at my discretion.

You can incorporate any manner of evil beings into this story, take things from mythology, horror films or your own creations, just don't be too obsurd.

You may kill off the main character if you so choose.

Have fun.
info.pretty_title: Things That Go Bump in the Night
